name: rose_aroma_science2015_treatment_one_variable_mean_sem_report_datapackage
title: Metabolite Univariate Group Comparison one variable Data Package

resources.name: rose-aroma-science2015-treatment-one-variable-mean-sem-report-datapackage
resources.title: reporting treatment group mean and sem

fields.name: chemical_name
fields.title: metabolite name
fields.description: the common name of a chemical compound

fields.name: inchi
fields.title: inchi string
fields.description: the field Metabolite Identity is meant to hold information such a metabolite database identifier

fields.name: chebi_identifier
fields.title: database identifier
fields.description: an identifier from chemical entity of biological interest database/ontology

fields.name: var1_levels
fields.title: levels for variable 1
fields.description: discrete levels of an independent variable

fields.name: var1_uri
fields.title: a resolvable uri for the levels of variable #1
fields.description: a uri for a discrete level of an independent variable

fields.name: treatment
fields.title: factor level combination
fields.description: a treatment group defined as combination of independent variable factor levels

fields.name: sample_size
fields.title: sample size
fields.description: statistical sample size is a count evaluating the number of individual experimental units in a treatment group

fields.name: sample_mean
fields.title: sample mean
fields.description: the sample mean is a measure of dispersion of the observations made on the sample and provides an unbias estimate of the population mean

fields.name: unit
fields.title: unit
fields.description: the unit associated with the sample mean

fields.name: sem
fields.title: standard error of the mean
fields.description: The standard error of the mean (SEM) is data item denoting the standard deviation of the sample-mean's estimate of a population mean. It is calculated by dividing the sample standard deviation (i.e., the sample-based estimate of the standard deviation of the population) by the square root of n , the size (number of observations) of the sample.
